headline: Potential AES Buyout Talks Raise Questions On Renewables Growth And Debt
summary: BlackRock’s Global Infrastructure Partners and EQT are reportedly in advanced talks over a potential acquisition of AES Corporation. The possible deal focuses on NYSE:AES, a major supplier of renewable energy, and could be finalized in the coming weeks. The outcome may affect AES’s ownership structure, capital plans, and future role in the energy transition. For investors watching NYSE:AES, the reported interest comes with the stock recently trading at $16.28. AES has a mixed return...

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider AES (AES) After A 67% One Year Rally?
summary: Wondering whether AES at around US$16.28 is offering real value right now, or if the recent enthusiasm has already been priced in. The stock has returned 0.2% over the last week, 14.7% over the last month, 9.9% year to date and 67.3% over the past year, although the 3-year and 5-year returns of 27.0% and 27.7% declines show a much tougher longer-term picture. Recent coverage of AES has focused on its position in the US utilities sector and how investors are reacting to its current share...

headline: Evergy to Post Q4 Earnings: What to Expect From the Stock?
summary: EVRG heads into Q4 results, with EPS expected to rise 63% y/y on grid investments and new rates, but rising interest costs are likely to have affected gains.

summary: Wind power capacity tops 159 GW in the US, and POR, PNW, ED and AES are ramping projects to capture rising demand.
